subject: mathematics
source: Uganda National Curriculum Development Centre (NCDC) - P2 Thematic Curriculum

themes.name: Our School and Neighbourhood
competences: Count objects up to 50
Read and write numbers 0-50
Compare numbers using greater than, less than, equal to
Add numbers within 20 using concrete materials
Subtract numbers within 20 using concrete materials
Recognize and name 2D shapes (circles, squares, rectangles, triangles)
Measure length using non-standard units
Tell time to the hour using analogue clock

themes.name: Our Home and Community
competences: Count money (coins and notes up to 10,000 shillings)
Perform simple transactions involving money
Skip count by 2s, 5s and 10s
Understand the concept of grouping objects
Solve simple word problems involving addition within 20
Classify objects by size, shape, colour
Order objects by length and height

themes.name: The Human Body and Health
competences: Count and identify body parts
Measure height and weight using standard units
Compare measurements of different individuals
Collect and organize data about health
Read and interpret simple pictograms
Use tally marks to record data
Solve problems involving measurements of body parts

themes.name: Food and Nutrition
competences: Count and compare quantities of food items
Recognize fraction concepts (halves and quarters) with food items
Measure quantities using standard units
Estimate quantities of food
Solve word problems involving food quantities
Add and subtract within 30 using food items
Recognize patterns in food sequences

themes.name: Transport in Our Community
competences: Count vehicles and represent using tally marks
Create and read simple bar graphs
Compare quantities of different types of transport
Add and subtract numbers within 30
Understand basic geometry of vehicles (wheels, doors)
Estimate distances
Solve problems involving time and distance

themes.name: Things We Make
competences: Recognize 3D shapes (cubes, cuboids, spheres, cylinders)
Describe properties of 3D shapes
Measure and compare dimensions of objects made
Recognize symmetry in objects
Use patterns in designs
Estimate and measure angles in objects
Solve problems involving shapes and measurements

themes.name: Accidents and Safety
competences: Collect and analyze data about accidents
Create pictograms showing accident statistics
Count and compare accident prevention strategies
Solve word problems related to safety
Measure time taken for first aid procedures
Calculate percentages of accident prevention knowledge
Interpret data on safety practices

themes.name: Work and Livelihoods
competences: Count earnings and expenses
Compare incomes of different occupations
Solve problems involving money and work
Understand basic budgeting concepts
Calculate simple profits and losses
Create and read charts showing employment data
Add and subtract larger numbers (within 100)

themes.name: Child Protection
competences: Collect and interpret data about child safety
Create graphs showing protection statistics
Understand basic probability concepts
Solve problems involving rights and protection
Count and classify types of abuse
Measure time related to child welfare
Interpret data on child protection practices

themes.name: Animals and Plants
competences: Count different types of animals and plants
Classify animals and plants by characteristics
Measure growth of plants over time
Create graphs showing animal and plant data
Understand patterns in animal and plant life cycles
Estimate populations
Solve problems involving living things

themes.name: Time and Seasons
competences: Read and write time to the half hour
Understand months and seasons
Create calendars and timelines
Calculate age and duration in months
Order events chronologically
Understand weather patterns across seasons
Solve problems involving time and seasons

themes.name: Water and Cleanliness
competences: Measure water quantities using standard units
Estimate water needed for different purposes
Collect and analyze water usage data
Create graphs about water conservation
Solve problems involving water measurements
Understand ratios in cleaning solutions
Calculate water consumption and cost

learning_outcomes: Develop number sense and understand place value
Perform arithmetic operations (addition and subtraction) accurately
Recognize, describe and compare 2D and 3D shapes
Measure length, mass, capacity and time
Solve problems using mathematics in real-life contexts
Develop mathematical reasoning and communication skills
